snippet: Economists said a prolonged ban could create shortages in China, where nearly 90 percent of the milk powder imported last year originated in New Zealand.
abstract: China halts imports of all milk powder from New Zealand and Australia after bacterium that can cause botulism is found in some dairy products.
lead_paragraph: Economists said a prolonged ban could create shortages in China, where nearly 90 percent of the milk powder imported last year originated in New Zealand.

headline.main: China Bans Milk Powder of 2 South Pacific Nations
headline.print_headline: China Bans Milk Powder Of 2 South Pacific Nations
